IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: On February 20, 2023, I (Sgt. D. Feltman, Maryland State Police, Criminal Enforcement Division, Firearms Enforcement Unit) received a Firearms Registration Unit (FRU) disapproval for application number 2023014178 from the Maryland State Police (MSP) Licensing Division regarding a possible stolen firearm. The firearm was identified as a Ruger (revolver), Model: Security Six, Caliber: .357 Mag, S/N- 15487764. The handgun was reported stolen through the Mesa Police Department (Arizona) on November 27, 1993. The firearm was awaiting disposition at the Machine Gun Nest, 7910 Reichs Ford Rd, Frederick, MD 21704, as part of a single purchase for a subject identified as Gregory Thornton West, W/M, 5/5/76, 8204 Blue Heron Dr., Frederick MD, 21701. All parties were notified of the stolen firearm hit and notice was made to Machine Gun Nest personnel that MSP personnel would respond to their shop to recover the handgun. On February 22, 2023, I contacted the Mesa Police Department (480 644-4048) and spoke to Beth Rabiola who was identified as a civilian in their records department. Ms. Rabiola was able to locate the original report, confirm the firearm was still actively listed as stolen, and further requested the firearm be returned to their department. On February 22, 2023, M/Tpr. Hegedus (Maryland State Police, Criminal Enforcement Division, Firearms Enforcement Unit) responded to the Machine Gun Nest and made contact with Isaac Burral who produced the suspected stolen handgun. M/Tpr. Hegedus positively identified the revolver as the same firearm noted through NCIC and proceeded to complete a MSP form 67 (Chain of Custody) for the firearm and provided Mr. Burral with a copy for his records. When asked about the acquisition of the Ruger, Burral advised the firearm was purchased online by Mr. West who was described as a frequent customer. The firearm was acquired from Old World Guns, LLC., 567 S. Main St., Camp Verde, Arizona 86322, on February 14, 2023, which would be consistent with the origin of the firearm. At approximately 1345 hrs., M/Tpr. Hegedus made contact with Police Communication Supervisor (PCS) Keyser from the MSP Hagerstown Barrack. After providing all pertinent information, PCS Keyser advised she sent the hit confirmation and locate to the Mesa Police Department for the stolen firearm. The firearm will be sent back to the Mesa Police Department in accordance with MSP policies and procedures. Case closed.
